result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert E Edwards Jr

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-6-22

Defendant Robert E Edwards Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Robert E Edwards Jr.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defendant has retained Attorney Robert Webb as counsel.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 40.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Proposed Order for Substitution of Counsel.
Received and Filed:  Stipulation for Substitution of Counsel.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING AND ARRAIGNMENT (15 pages) commencing 08-23-22 by DENISE PAHMAN.

Defendant Robert E Edwards Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Robert E Edwards Jr.   Abby Rockendorf appeared in person in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judicial Notice to case 14CF4792. Sworn for the State: Detective S. Osmanski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-22-22
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Robert E Edwards in court with attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo. Defendant Robert E Edwards in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert E Edwards appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
